{{Infobox political party | country = Egypt | party_name = Free Social Constitutional Party | native_name = Al-Hizb Al-Distouri
Ø§ÙØ­Ø²Ø¨ Ø§ÙØ¯Ø³ØªÙØ±Ù Ø§ÙØ§Ø¬ØªÙØ§Ø¹Ù Ø§ÙØ­Ø± | chairman = [[Mamdouh Qenawi]] | foundation = 2004 | headquarters = [[Cairo]] | ideology = [[Liberal Democracy]], [[Socialism]] | newspaper = | website = | colorcode = black }} The '''Free Social Constitutional Party''' or '''Al-Hizb Al-Distouri''' ({{lang-ar|Ø§ÙØ­Ø²Ø¨ Ø§ÙØ¯Ø³ØªÙØ±Ù Ø§ÙØ§Ø¬ØªÙØ§Ø¹Ù Ø§ÙØ­Ø±}}) is a [[political party]] in [[Egypt]]. The Free Social Constitutional Party might be considered as a [[liberal parties|liberal party]]. == Platform == * Drafting a new Constitution. * Reforming education. * Reforming the health sector. * Creating a favorable investment atmosphere, ensuring swift justice, eliminating red tape, reducing taxes and providing high-quality services. * Supervising the State Budget * Approving the appointment of senior State officials by the People's Assembly. * Establishing a poor bank. == See also == *[[Liberalism]] *[[Contributions to liberal theory]] *[[Liberalism worldwide]] *[[List of liberal parties]] *[[Liberal democracy]] *[[Liberalism in Egypt]] == External links == *[http://www2.sis.gov.eg/En/Politics/Parties/Parties/041102000000000018.htm Free Social Constitutional Party on Egypt State Information Service (SIS)] {{Egyptian political parties}} [[Category:Liberal parties]] [[Category:Political parties in Egypt]] [[Category:Political parties established in 2004]] [[Category:2004 establishments in Egypt]] {{liberalparty-stub}} {{Egypt-party-stub}} [[ar:Ø§ÙØ­Ø²Ø¨ Ø§ÙØ¯Ø³ØªÙØ±Ù Ø§ÙØ§Ø¬ØªÙØ§Ø¹Ù Ø§ÙØ­Ø±]]
